poem:
"An Echo of Names"

In the land of the rising sun,
500 years hence, all Sato.
A hum of sameness in pale dawn.
Marriage, an economy of names.
And so ascends the single cry,
reverberating through the temple eaves.
Yet, in the whisper of each leaf,
a thousand tongues still dream.
Subsumed, not silenced,
In the heart of the single name,
A multitude pulses.
